text:
“We were made by God, and it is enough for us to remember our divine origins to comply with his will, which asks to be perfect as our Heavenly Father is perfect — in his mercy....God does nothing for himself; all creation is designed for his offspring.”

— Robert Cardinal Sarah
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
“Forgiveness is beginning again to love with more gratuitousness and generosity when love has been badly hurt.”

— Robert Cardinal Sarah, “God or Nothing”
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
I was saddened to learn that Cardinal Schonborn has been diagnosed with cancer. I’m praying for his speedy recovery. 

Here’s my interview with him, on how Europe must recover its Judeo-Christian roots. (He’s sent me handwritten Christmas cards since.)
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
Why Christians must never give an inch to anti-Semitism:

“We are the children of Abraham, our father in faith, and we belong to the lines of the spiritual descendants of the people of the Exodus,” a people of the “desert.”

— Robert Cardinal Sarah
author: SohrabAhmari

text: One at a time...
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
“Philosophy, even without Revelation, can...arrive at God as the final cause. But the rejection of God...confines philosophy to the realm of matter alone...Why would a thinker want to commit himself to a sort of regression and to reject a discovery of man?”

— Cardinal Sarah
author: SohrabAhmari

text: I may not like every outcome, but these underhanded methods are anti-democratic and ultimately breed more popular resentment.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: This is also a moment to say: Enough is enough with liberal elites’ use of police and juridical power to undo voters’ choices at the ballot box—whether that’s Trump, Brexit or opposition to immigration in Poland, Hungary, Italy and the like.
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
BOOM! 

Or not.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Correct, but Benedict is also talking about the Jewish encounter with the Hellenic world centuries before our Lord. An encounter that he again sees as providentially ordained.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Aye. It is. I’m trying to make the best of it, but my message will probably go over Jeet’s head.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: As Pope Benedict XVI has taught, it was no accident that both the children of Israel and the earliest Christian communities found themselves embedded in Greco-Roman civilization. Almighty God prepared the marriage between faith and philosophy.
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
That’s why we should be grateful to Providence for embedding Christianity in Greek culture, to purify and baptize what was noble and worthwhile in the pagan world — the thirst for transcendent Truth — while discarding much else.

In the beginning was the LOGOS.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Yes.
author: SohrabAhmari

text:

Since the whole column is a subtle but transparent attempt to pre-frame the Mueller report as somehow bad for Trump. 

https://thebulwark.com/four-arguments-about-the-mueller-report-you-should-ignore/ …

text:

As I predicted two-dozen times on the @Commentary podcast. I said no “collusion” will turn up, and the whole thing will fizzle.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: If you read two great Victorians--John Henry Newman and Matthew Arnold--in tandem, you'll have a powerful explanatory key to the problems of our age.

text: "There are a lot of live debates among conservative writers right now. On many of them, I hope that the point of view represented by the manifesto prevails."

text:

text:
To reform the whole mindset that led to the college-cheating scandal is a generational, civilizational task. 

Here's how one small Catholic college in California is pitching in. 

My latest.
https://catholicherald.co.uk/magazine/the-tiny-college-that-shows-how-to-save-us-higher-education/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
De Blasio's Manhattan swagger and large entourage apparently frightened away all the quaint provincials in New Hampshire.

The mayor spoke to sparse crowds ranging from 40 people to six. Yes, six.

Hilarious @redsteeze on Blas' sad road show. https://nypost.com/2019/03/21/de-blasios-sad-road-show/ …

text: Oh my God.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: The mayor of London has shared platforms with Daud Abdullah of the Muslim Council of Britain, which has boycotted Holocaust Memorial Day, and Ibrahim Hewitt of Interpal, which in 2003 was added to the U.S. Treasury’s list of Specially Designated Global Terrorist Organizations.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: We seek to revive the virtues of liberality and neighborliness that many people describe as “liberalism.” But we oppose any attempt to conflate American interests with liberal ideology.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: I recently sat down with Fox News' @LaurenGreenFox to talk about faith, Islam, the pope's visit to Abu Dhabi and, of course, "FROM FIRE, BY WATER."
author: SohrabAhmari

text: For the purpose of signing this document, and only for this purpose, I identify as a woman. I dare you to question my subjective self-identification.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: I imagine many other signers fall elsewhere, on a spectrum from me to full isolationist. So this is one of the areas where we can hope the document will spur further discussion across the broad right.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: On foreign policy, I describe myself as a (John) Boltonian--a hawk without liberalizing illusions or ambitions.
author: SohrabAhmari

author: SohrabAhmari

text:
Whatever else might be said about it, the Trump phenomenon has opened up space in which to pose the first questions anew. We will guard that space jealously. 

Against the dead (conservative) consensus.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: The most striking thing about @TACollege is the campus culture: the modesty of dress; properly ordered relations between the sexes; the fact that St Patrick’s Day festivities involve moderate drink and Irish balladry
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Precisely because Catholicism proclaims absolute Truth, the faith can liberate liberal-arts education from the narrow specialization, technocratic blandness and haphazard quality of modern secular education.  https://catholicherald.co.uk/magazine/the-tiny-college-that-shows-how-to-save-us-higher-education/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
In 2017, three of the 10 institutions named among America’s worst colleges for free speech by the Foundation for Individual Rights in Education were Catholic ones: Georgetown, DePaul, Fordham.

Here's what the alternative looks like. https://catholicherald.co.uk/magazine/the-tiny-college-that-shows-how-to-save-us-higher-education/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text: What the Catholic antidote to the college-cheating scandal looks like. https://catholicherald.co.uk/magazine/the-tiny-college-that-shows-how-to-save-us-higher-education/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text: If there is no such thing as transcendent truth, aren’t the cheaters in a sense to be commended for following our civilisational logic to its terminus? I kid. Lawbreakers should be punished. But true reform begins with shifting that civilisational logic. https://catholicherald.co.uk/magazine/the-tiny-college-that-shows-how-to-save-us-higher-education/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Tempted to donate to big-name, Catholic-in-name-only Catholic schools? Save your money and visit @TACollege instead. https://catholicherald.co.uk/magazine/the-tiny-college-that-shows-how-to-save-us-higher-education/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
I recently visited Thomas Aquinas College, in @TACollege, and there I found an antidote to the college-cheating scandal. 

My latest Catholic Herald column.

https://catholicherald.co.uk/magazine/the-tiny-college-that-shows-how-to-save-us-higher-education/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text: John Podhoretz drops a hammer on Democrats' efforts to radically remake our constitutional order.
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
The great Yuval Levin reacts to "Against the Dead Consensus":  

"It’s a promising and heartening statement of principles."
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Scrapping the admissions test for NYC's specialized high schools won't fix the underlying problem: NYC K-8 schools fail too many black and Latino children.  It will only hide and paper over the problem.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Contrary to perennial claims by Mayor Bill de Blasio and his virtue-signaling allies, the Specialized High-School Admissions Test, or SHSAT, isn’t the reason just seven black students were accepted to Stuyvesant this year. https://nypost.com/2019/03/20/the-drive-to-change-elite-school-admissions-is-all-about-killing-the-messenger/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Getting private messages from folks asking: "Wait, you're not a libertarian!" Indeed, I'm not. Going back to my WSJ days, you could have traced the anti-libertarian thread in my writing.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: But Reagan himself would be the first to call for prudential flexibility in the face of new challenges.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: There are reasonable midway points between Hobbit Village and Blade Runner LA.
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
We must not prioritize the needs of the childless, the healthy, and the intellectually competitive. Our policy must accommodate the messy demands of authentic human attachments: family, faith, and the political community.

For a post-Trump conservatism.

 https://www.firstthings.com/web-exclusives/2019/03/against-the-dead-consensus …
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
For those who enjoy the upsides, a borderless world brings intoxicating new liberties. But the jet-setters’ vision clashes with the human need for a common life. 

We believe home matters.

A conservative manifesto, against the old consensus. https://www.firstthings.com/web-exclusives/2019/03/against-the-dead-consensus …
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Against the Dead (Conservative) Consensus: or, Buh-Bye Libertarian "Conservatism." https://www.firstthings.com/web-exclusives/2019/03/against-the-dead-consensus …
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
Some of us were enthusiastic Trumpers while others of us were equally vehement Never Trumpers. 

Today we speak with one voice: There is no returning to the failed conservative consensus that collapsed in 2016. https://www.firstthings.com/web-exclusives/2019/03/against-the-dead-consensus …
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
“Any attempt to revive the failed conservative consensus that preceded Trump would be misguided and harmful to the right.”

Proud to add my name to this manifesto: Against the Dead Conservative Consensus
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Lost your journalism gig for making false claims about law enforcers? Come teach would-be reporters at @nyuniversity!
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
Marijuana does profound damage to memory. Scientists who tracked nearly 4,000 young adults into their 40s confirmed that marijuana use does lasting damage to memory.

But none of the politicians pushing legalization even mentions any of this.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Stop ignoring the brutal downside of legal pot https://nypost.com/2019/03/19/stop-ignoring-the-brutal-downside-of-legal-pot/ …
author: SohrabAhmari

text:
The @splcenter turned an originally noble mission into an ideological racket--making money off of smearing anyone to the right of itself as bigoted. Let's hope its recent implosion will prompt a profound rethink.

Must-read @RichLowry
author: SohrabAhmari

text: New life goal: a campaign to bring the Concorde out of retirement.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: OK, I've now read A LOT about the Concorde crash, and the Concorde more generally, and I don't understand why the whole fleet was permanently grounded. This was a magnificent aircraft. One single (admittedly awful) crash in a 30-year operational history and they canceled it!?
author: SohrabAhmari

text: #ProTip Don’t read about, or watch footage of, the 2003 Concorde crash just as your own aircraft is about to take off. It’s freaky.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: Remember when certain Never Trumpers seriously claimed that Trump had colluded with Saudi to expose Bezos and embarrass the great, er, organ of the #Resistance? And these Never Trumpers insisted that *this* is the thing that would finally topple Trump?

text: Have had a delightful time at @TACollege so far. It’s a place thick with Catholic identity. For example, one’s eyes constantly come to rest on the Cross here (because there are so many crucifixes around). The academic pursuit of truth, carried out in the light of crucified Truth.
author: SohrabAhmari

text: The closest I’ve come to having my own private chapel (for one night) at @TACollege —
